title: PMP Full Practice Exam - 180 Questions
description: Complete 180-question PMP practice exam covering People, Process, and Business Environment domains with 230-minute time limit

questions.question: A team member is underperforming on critical tasks. What should you do first? (Scenario 1)
options: Escalate to the project sponsor immediately
Document the issue and continue as planned
Analyze the situation and determine root cause before taking action
Implement corrective action without delay
questions.explanation: This approach follows PMI best practices by ensuring proper analysis before action. It demonstrates professional responsibility and stakeholder engagement.

questions.question: Two stakeholders have conflicting requirements. How should you resolve this? (Scenario 2)
options: Update the risk register and monitor closely
Conduct a team meeting to discuss the situation
Follow the defined process in the project management plan
Consult with subject matter experts for guidance
questions.explanation: The correct answer aligns with the PMBOK Guide principles of proactive management and following established processes while maintaining flexibility.

questions.question: Your team is resistant to a new process. What is the best approach? (Scenario 3)
options: Make a quick decision to avoid delays
Gather more information and analyze options
Defer the decision to the sponsor
Use the lessons learned register for guidance
questions.explanation: This solution best addresses the root cause while maintaining project objectives and stakeholder satisfaction through collaborative decision-making.

questions.question: A key team member wants to leave the project. What should you do? (Scenario 4)
options: Continue with the current plan
Request additional budget or resources
Implement a workaround solution
Perform impact analysis and present options to stakeholders
questions.explanation: According to PMP standards, this response properly balances analysis, communication, and appropriate escalation while respecting team dynamics.

questions.question: Team morale is low after a failed sprint. How should you address this? (Scenario 5)
options: Escalate to the project sponsor immediately
Document the issue and continue as planned
Analyze the situation and determine root cause before taking action
Implement corrective action without delay
questions.explanation: This approach follows PMI best practices by ensuring proper analysis before action. It demonstrates professional responsibility and stakeholder engagement.

Defer the decision to the sponsor
Use the lessons learned register for guidance
questions.explanation: This solution best addresses the root cause while maintaining project objectives and stakeholder satisfaction through collaborative decision-making.

questions.question: Market conditions have changed affecting project value. What is your response? (Scenario 174)
options: Continue with the current plan
Request additional budget or resources
Implement a workaround solution
Perform impact analysis and present options to stakeholders
questions.explanation: According to PMP standards, this response properly balances analysis, communication, and appropriate escalation while respecting team dynamics.

questions.question: The organization is implementing a new governance framework. How do you adapt? (Scenario 175)
options: Escalate to the project sponsor immediately
Document the issue and continue as planned
Analyze the situation and determine root cause before taking action
Implement corrective action without delay
questions.explanation: This approach follows PMI best practices by ensuring proper analysis before action. It demonstrates professional responsibility and stakeholder engagement.

questions.question: A competitor launches a similar product. How should this affect your project? (Scenario 176)
options: Update the risk register and monitor closely
Conduct a team meeting to discuss the situation
Follow the defined process in the project management plan
Consult with subject matter experts for guidance
questions.explanation: The correct answer aligns with the PMBOK Guide principles of proactive management and following established processes while maintaining flexibility.

questions.question: Senior management wants to change project priorities mid-execution. How should you respond? (Scenario 177)
options: Make a quick decision to avoid delays
Gather more information and analyze options
Defer the decision to the sponsor
Use the lessons learned register for guidance
questions.explanation: This solution best addresses the root cause while maintaining project objectives and stakeholder satisfaction through collaborative decision-making.
